intro: Hieracium inauratum, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn, often forming dense clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and can grow up to 60 centimeters tall. Hieracium inauratum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
